pros:
I have worked for a few colleges and I can honestly say, this one truly cares about the students that attend here. They take the time each morning to discuss students who may be struggling and how they can help.  Furthermore, a school like this serves a true need which explains its high job placement rate.  

The aviation industry is in dire need of technicians and aviation electronic workers. So much so, that several industry leading companies come out to do presentations several times a year.  The list of presentations is almost weekly by numerous different industry leaders.  

As an employee I see the company making a turn for greatness. This school and its programs are a secret waiting to explode on to the Aviation world.  the executive team listens to its employees on ideas and new directions.  This empowers employees to truly believe they can make a difference. There is definitely a team atmosphere here.  Spartan College is on the rise and will soon be an industry leader in Aviation Education.
cons: After the name change a couple of years ago, few people know about this amazing school. Especially in the local area surrounding the campus.  Hopefully, in time, the public will get to know Spartan. But for now the school is working hard to show how this school can truly benefit a student looking for an Aviation Career.

pros: Staff care about the students.  We have an opportunity to impact our students lives for the better every day.    Co-workers are friendly and always willing to help.  Staff is dedicated to help our students and work well together to get them to graduation.  The people and the students make this a great place to work!
cons: Facility can use some TLC but improvements are slowly coming.

pros: Lots of experience, Some good co-workers

Insurance was very expensive through Spartan.
